thread.title: Re: Hot mess: Carbon footprint from the Standing Rock protest just got a LOT bigger [photos, video]
thread.title_full: Re: Hot mess: Carbon footprint from the Standing Rock protest just got a LOT bigger [photos, video]

author: Ken
title: Re: Hot mess: Carbon footprint from the Standing Rock protest just got a LOT bigger [photos, video]
text:
Hot mess: Carbon footprint from the Standing Rock protest just got a LOT bigger; Updated [photos, video] Posted at 11:14 am on February 22, 2017 by Doug P. 
In North Dakota, the deadline for Standing Rock protesters to leave their “no Dakota Access Pipeline” protest camps is today, and many are still there. Law enforcement in place, some #NoDAPL protestors holding their ground. Evacuation deadline at 2pm. #StandingRock https://t.co/6I8WkwrhRQ 
— Sara Sidner (@sarasidnerCNN) February 22, 2017 Dozens of Deputies, Troopers & Police heading toward #StandingRock & #NoDAPL camp. As evacuation nears. Last evac order this didn't happen. pic.twitter.com/NKxra1PC6v 
— Sara Sidner (@sarasidnerCNN) February 22, 2017 
We’ve told you in recent days and weeks about the trash that’s been left behind as a result of the “environmentalists” who are really concerned about a clean environment. Today, the carbon footprint got deeper and wider, and it’s a full-blown hot mess — literally: Dakota Access Pipeline protestors ceremonially burn their camp sites before they're forced to vacate: pic.twitter.com/jEUimLEatb
